title: On Car-Free Streets, Many New York Restaurants Thrived
description: By promoting outdoor dining, the cityâ€™s Open Streets program has helped some eating and drinking establishments survive the pandemic, a new report finds.
dc:creator: Winnie Hu
media:credit: Sebastian Mejias for The New York Times
media:description: In Brooklyn, neighbors started a six-block Open Street on Vanderbilt Avenue in 2020. Now, 24 restaurants offer outdoor dining there.
